question:
A restaurant has placed an advertisement for waiters and waitresses in your local newspaper. Write a letter to the restaurant, applying for at the job. In your letter:

Explain what you are currently doing
Describe your suitability for this area of work
Say when you can attend an interview
text: I am writing to apply for the job opening for a waitress in your respected / reputed restaurant. I came across this opportunity in today’s newspaper and believe that my experience aligns with the requirements of this role.

Let me explain my situation in more detail. Currently, I am working as a Kitchen Hand at The Lotus in Ultimo. I have been working here for the past 2 years and help the Chef by performing duties like serving customers and cleaning the restaurant.

With my extensive in the hospitality industry I have amazed by manager with my ability to carry 5-6 plates at once and thus appreciated my pace of serving the customers. I am sure this will be beneficial during busy periods.
I will be available for an interview at all times from Tuesday-Friday. I will be more than happy to cooperate during any other times, if these times conflict with your schedule.
I look forward to a positive response from your end.

error_list.error_des: It appears that you are missing a comma after the introductory phrase With my extensive in the hospitality industry. Consider adding a comma.
It seems that you are missing a verb. Consider adding it.
The noun phrase manager seems to be missing a determiner before it. Consider adding an article.
It appears that you have an unnecessary comma before the dependent clause marker if. Consider removing the comma.
